description: PDFEncrypt is a free, simple, open-source utility to encrypt PDF files using standard PDF encryption algorithms.  When a document is encrypted, its contents become unreadable. An authorized user can decrypt the document to obtain access to the contents. If a PDF document is encrypted with a password, the user must specify the password before the document can be viewed in many PDF readers (e.g. Adobe Reader or Adobe Acrobat among others).
summary: Password protect (encrypt) PDF files for free.
author: Ryan Griggs
